title: Taipei Blues
description: A slice-of-life story about a chef and a waitress who were ex-lovers, working together at a Chinese restaurant in Taipei.

chapters.title: 晚餐高峰
chapters.description: 繁忙夜晚，特別要求，兩人不得不溝通。

sentences.晚上，餐廳裡人很多，很吵。: In the evening, the restaurant was very crowded and noisy.
sentences.小美在客人之間走來走去，非常忙。: Xiao Mei walked back and forth among the customers, extremely busy.
sentences.她有一個客人，點了很多菜，但是他都不喜歡。: She had a customer who ordered many dishes, but disliked all of them.
sentences.客人對小美說：「小姐，這些菜都不太合我的胃口。: The customer said to Xiao Mei, 'Miss, none of these dishes are quite to my taste.
sentences.我想要一個特別的，菜單上沒有的菜。: I'd like something special, a dish not on the menu.
sentences.你可以請廚師做一道清淡的魚湯嗎？: Could you ask the chef to make a light fish soup?'
sentences.現在是晚餐高峰，廚房一定很忙。: It was dinner rush hour, and the kitchen must be very busy.
sentences.她走到廚房門口，看到李明正在大火前炒菜，汗水從他的額頭流下來。: She walked to the kitchen entrance and saw Li Ming stir-frying in front of a high flame, sweat dripping from his forehead.
sentences.小美輕聲說：「李明，不好意思。: Xiao Mei whispered, 'Li Ming, excuse me.
sentences.外面有一個客人，他對所有的菜都不滿意。: There's a customer outside who's unhappy with all the dishes.
sentences.他想吃一個特別的清淡魚湯。: He wants a special, light fish soup.'
sentences.他臉上有些疲憊，但是當他看到小美焦急的眼神，他沒有生氣。: There was some fatigue on his face, but when he saw Xiao Mei's anxious look, he didn't get angry.
sentences.現在很忙，你知道的。: It's really busy right now, you know.'
sentences.他說他只喜歡清淡的。: He said he only likes light food.'
sentences.他想起以前小美也喜歡吃清淡的食物。: He remembered that Xiao Mei used to like light food too.
sentences.他深吸一口氣，說：「好吧。: He took a deep breath and said, 'Alright.
sentences.我去看看有沒有新鮮的魚。: I'll go see if there's any fresh fish.
sentences.你先去跟客人說，要等一下。: You go tell the customer first that they'll have to wait a bit.'
sentences.她對李明露出一個小小的笑容：「謝謝你，李明。: She gave Li Ming a small smile, 'Thank you, Li Ming.
sentences.小美看著他的背影，心裡感覺暖暖的。: Xiao Mei watched his retreating back, feeling a warmth in her heart.
sentences.她知道，即使他們分手了，李明還是會幫她。: She knew that even though they had broken up, Li Ming would still help her.
sentences.小美回到餐廳前面，準備和客人解釋。: Xiao Mei returned to the front of the restaurant, ready to explain to the customer.
sentences.廚房裡，李明已經開始準備那一碗特別的魚湯了。: In the kitchen, Li Ming had already started preparing that special bowl of fish soup.
sentences.」小美有點為難。: Xiao Mei felt a bit awkward.
sentences.」李明停下手，轉過頭看著小美。: Li Ming stopped what he was doing and turned to look at Xiao Mei.
sentences.」李明想了一下。: Li Ming thought for a moment.
sentences.」小美聽了，心裡鬆了一口氣。: Xiao Mei felt a wave of relief when she heard that.
sentences.」李明沒有說話，只是點點頭，然後轉身走向冰櫃。: Li Ming didn't say anything, just nodded, then turned and walked towards the freezer.

sentences.餐厅里，午饭时间很忙。: The restaurant was bustling during lunchtime.
sentences.李明在厨房里，忙着炒菜。: Li Ming was in the kitchen, busy stir-frying dishes.
sentences.小美在外面，笑着对客人说：“您好，请问您想点什么？: Xiao Mei was in the dining area, smiling as she asked a guest, "Hello, what would you like to order?"
sentences.她把点菜单写好，然后大声对厨房里说：“李明，一份番茄炒蛋，一份炒饭！: She finished writing down the order, then loudly called out to the kitchen, "Li Ming, one tomato and scrambled eggs, one fried rice!"
sentences.他拿着的勺子慢了下来。: The spoon in his hand slowed down.
sentences.番茄炒蛋……这是以前小美最喜欢吃的菜。: Tomato and scrambled eggs... This used to be Xiao Mei's favorite dish.
sentences.他们下班后，李明常常做这道菜给小美吃。: After they got off work, Li Ming often made this dish for Xiao Mei.
sentences.那时，小美总是开心地笑着，说：“李明，你做的番茄炒蛋真好吃！: Back then, Xiao Mei would always smile happily and say, "Li Ming, your tomato and scrambled eggs are so delicious!"
sentences.她看着厨房的方向，李明正背对着她。: She looked towards the kitchen, where Li Ming had his back to her.
sentences.她的笑容有点不自然。: Her smile was a little unnatural.
sentences.他们以前关系很好，现在却像陌生人一样。: Their relationship used to be very good, but now they were like strangers.
sentences.李明炒菜的声音又快了起来。: The sound of Li Ming stir-frying sped up again.
sentences.他没有回头看小美。: He didn't turn around to look at Xiao Mei.
sentences.小美也转过身，继续去服务其他的客人。: Xiao Mei also turned around and continued to serve other guests.
sentences.番茄炒蛋的香味慢慢从厨房里飘出来，空气中多了一点尴尬。: The aroma of the tomato and scrambled eggs slowly wafted out from the kitchen, and a hint of awkwardness filled the air.
sentences.他们都忙着，心里却都想着那道熟悉的菜和那些回不去的过去。: They were both busy, yet in their hearts, they were thinking of that familiar dish and the past they could never return to.
sentences.”一位客人拿起菜单，看了一会儿，说：“我要一份番茄炒蛋，再来一份炒饭。: A guest picked up the menu, looked at it for a moment, and said, "I'd like the stir-fried tomato and scrambled eggs, and also some fried rice."
sentences.”小美听到“番茄炒蛋”这几个字，手微微停了一下。: Upon hearing the words "stir-fried tomato and scrambled eggs," Xiao Mei's hand paused slightly.
sentences.”李明在厨房里也听到了。: Li Ming in the kitchen heard her too.
sentences.”小美也想起了以前。: Xiao Mei also recalled the past.

chapters.title: The Taste of Old
chapters.description: Customer Rejects the Egg, Old Flame Recalls Perfect Taste.

sentences.餐廳裡，午餐時間還是很忙。: The restaurant was bustling during lunchtime.
sentences.李明在廚房裡忙著做菜，小美在外面為客人服務。: Li Ming was busy cooking in the kitchen, while Xiao Mei served customers outside.
sentences.一個年輕的客人叫住小美。: A young customer called out to Xiao Mei.
sentences.「小姐，這個番茄炒蛋…味道不太對。: "Miss, this scrambled eggs with tomato... the taste isn't quite right."
sentences.」客人把盤子推了回來。: The customer pushed the plate back.
sentences.小美接過盤子，心裡有點奇怪。: Xiao Mei took the plate, feeling a bit puzzled.
sentences.番茄炒蛋是店裡很受歡迎的菜。: Scrambled eggs with tomato was a very popular dish at the restaurant.
sentences.她看了看盤子裡的蛋，然後走進廚房，來到李明旁邊。: She looked at the eggs on the plate, then walked into the kitchen and went up to Li Ming.
sentences.「李明，這個客人說番茄炒蛋的味道不太對。: "Li Ming, this customer says the scrambled eggs with tomato doesn't taste quite right."
sentences.」小美小聲說，把盤子放在櫃檯上。: Xiao Mei whispered, placing the plate on the counter.
sentences.李明停下手上的工作，看向那盤菜。: Li Ming stopped what he was doing and looked at the dish.
sentences.紅色的番茄，黃色的蛋，看起來和平常一樣。: The red tomatoes and yellow eggs looked the same as usual.
sentences.但他知道，味道不是只有「看起來」。: But he knew that taste wasn't just about how it looked.
sentences.他想起以前，小美總說他做的番茄炒蛋是「最好吃的」。: He remembered how Xiao Mei used to always say his scrambled eggs with tomato was "the best."
sentences.小美也看著那盤菜，她的腦海裡浮現出另一個畫面。: Xiao Mei also looked at the dish, and another image surfaced in her mind.
sentences.她記得，以前他們兩個常常一起做番茄炒蛋。: She remembered that they used to often make scrambled eggs with tomato together.
sentences.那時候，他們會為了哪一種番茄更好吃而笑，會為了蛋炒得夠不夠滑而爭論。: Back then, they would laugh about which type of tomato tasted better and argue about whether the eggs were scrambled smoothly enough.
sentences.那時候的味道，對他們來說，是很特別的。: The taste from that time was very special to them.
sentences.「客人說…跟以前吃的不一樣。: "The customer said... it's different from what they used to eat before."
sentences.」小美輕聲補充，眼神裡帶著一點點複雜的情緒。: Xiao Mei added softly, a hint of complex emotion in her eyes.
sentences.他拿起盤子，看了一眼小美。: He picked up the plate and glanced at Xiao Mei.
sentences.她的臉上，好像也寫著「以前」兩個字。: On her face, the word "past" also seemed to be written.
sentences.那種過去「完美」的味道，現在去了哪裡？: Where had that "perfect" taste from the past gone now?
sentences.聲音很低，像平常一樣。: His voice was low, as usual.
sentences.小美點點頭，轉身走了出去。: Xiao Mei nodded, then turned and walked out.
sentences.廚房裡的空氣，突然變得有點重。: The air in the kitchen suddenly became a bit heavy.
sentences.李明看著新的番茄和蛋，他知道，有些味道，是找不回來的。: Li Ming looked at the fresh tomatoes and eggs, knowing that some tastes could never be brought back.
sentences.但他也知道，有些東西，他想努力地再試一次。: But he also knew there were some things he wanted to try hard for, one more time.
